definition: a counting device with beads or disks
sentence: She used an abacus to do math.

definition: deserted or forsaken

definition: act of abandoning or being abandoned

definition: to degrade or humiliate

definition: to embarrass or make ashamed

definition: to become less intense or widespread

definition: the act of reducing or lessening

definition: a slaughterhouse for animals

definition: a monastery or convent

definition: the superior of an abbey or monastery

definition: a shortened form of a word or phrase

definition: to renounce or give up a position of power

definition: the act of abdicating or giving up power
sentence: The abdication of the queen shocked the nation.

definition: the region of the body between the chest and the pelvis

definition: to kidnap or take away by force

definition: the act of kidnapping or taking by force

definition: deviating from the norm or usual pattern

definition: a departure from what is normal or expected

definition: to assist, encourage, or support (usually in wrongdoing)
sentence: His friends abetted him in his plan to steal the car.

definition: temporary suspension or inactivity

definition: to hate or detest
sentence: She abhorred cruelty towards animals and became vegetarian.

definition: intense disgust or hatred

definition: completely opposed or repugnant

definition: to accept or act in accordance with

definition: the power or skill to do something

definition: extremely miserable or contemptible

definition: to renounce or reject

definition: burning fiercely or brightly

definition: capable or competent to do something

definition: deviating from what is normal or usual

definition: on or onto a ship, aircraft, or train

definition: a place where one lives or resides

definition: to formally put an end to (a system or practice)

definition: very unpleasant or detestable

definition: a thing that causes disgust or hatred

definition: indigenous or native to a particular region

definition: termination of pregnancy before the fetus can survive

definition: unsuccessful or failing to achieve the intended result

definition: open and honest, without deceit or trickery

definition: to scrape or wear away by friction or erosion

definition: a scrape or a graze on the skin or surface

definition: causing abrasion or friction; harsh or rough

definition: side by side and facing the same direction

definition: in or to a foreign country or place

definition: to abolish, revoke, or formally annul

definition: sudden or unexpected; brief and curt
sentence: The meeting came to an abrupt end due to a power outage.

definition: a localized collection of pus in a body tissue

definition: to leave hurriedly and secretly

definition: the state of being away or not present

definition: not present or in attendance; missing

definition: to declare someone free from guilt, blame, or responsibility

definition: the process of absorbing or being absorbed

definition: to refrain or choose not to do something

definition: difficult to understand; obscure or arcane

definition: the quality or state of being absurd

definition: a very large quantity or amount; plenty or more than enough

definition: existing or available in large quantities; plentiful

definition: relating to education, schools, or universities

definition: to agree or give consent to a demand or request

sentence: The company's ascendancy in the market was evident.

definition: to find out or determine with certainty
sentence: The detective conducted further investigations to ascertain truth.

definition: practicing self-discipline and abstinence
sentence: The ascetic monk lived a simple and austere life.

definition: to attribute or assign something to a particular cause
sentence: Many people ascribe their success to hard work.

definition: with suspicion or disapproval
sentence: She looked askance at his extravagant purchase.

definition: roughness or harshness, especially of tone or manner
sentence: The manager spoke with asperity, criticizing employees.

definition: a strong desire or ambition; a goal or objective
sentence: His aspiration is to become a successful entrepreneur.

definition: to attack vigorously or criticize strongly
sentence: The critics assailed the author's latest novel.

definition: to express agreement or approval
sentence: The committee members assented to the proposed changes.

definition: confident and forceful in expressing oneself
sentence: She was known for her assertive leadership style.

definition: diligent, hardworking, and persistent
sentence: Her assiduous efforts paid off when she secured position.

definition: to absorb and integrate into a larger group
sentence: Immigrants often go through a process of assimilating.

definition: to make an unpleasant feeling less intense
sentence: The medicine helped assuage her pain.

definition: a guarantee or confidence in one's abilities
sentence: She provided assurance that the project would be completed.

definition: amazing or astonishing in a surprising way
sentence: Her performance was astounding, leaving audience in awe.

definition: quick-witted and perceptive; shrewd
sentence: The astute businessman made strategic decisions.

definition: protection granted to a person seeking refuge
sentence: The political dissident sought asylum in neighboring country.

definition: the reappearance of a trait after it skipped generations
sentence: In some rare cases, humans exhibit atavism.

definition: to make amends or seek forgiveness for a wrongdoing
sentence: He tried to atone for his mistake by apologizing.

definition: extremely cruel, brutal, or wicked
sentence: The prisoners were subjected to atrocious treatment.

definition: to achieve or accomplish
sentence: She worked hard to attain her dream of becoming doctor.

definition: to reduce in force, value, or intensity
sentence: The medication helped attenuate the symptoms.

definition: to provide evidence or testify to the truth of
sentence: Several witnesses attested to the defendant's innocence.

definition: clothing or apparel
sentence: The guests were expected to dress in formal attire.

definition: to regard as being caused by or belonging to
sentence: They attribute their success to hard work and perseverance.

definition: the act of attributing or ascribing something
sentence: The journalist failed to provide proper attribution.

definition: bold, daring, or fearless
sentence: The audacious climber scaled the treacherous mountain peak.

definition: boldness or daring courage
sentence: He had the audacity to ask for a raise after month.

definition: able to be heard or perceived by the ear
sentence: The sound of the waves was barely audible from distance.

definition: to increase or enhance in size, amount, or value
sentence: They decided to augment their workforce to meet demand.

definition: to predict or foreshadow something
sentence: The dark clouds augur an approaching storm.

definition: a sign or omen that is believed to predict future
sentence: The sighting of a shooting star was an augury of luck.

definition: promising success; favorable or fortunate
sentence: The newlyweds considered it an auspicious start.

definition: severe or strict in manner, attitude, or style
sentence: The austere professor demanded excellence from students.

definition: strictness or severity, especially in terms of living
sentence: The country imposed austerity measures to combat crisis.

definition: genuine; not counterfeit or copied
sentence: The museum displayed authentic artifacts from civilizations.

definition: favoring or enforcing strict obedience to authority
sentence: The regime was known for its authoritarian rule.

definition: having the power or right to give orders
sentence: The professor's authoritative voice commanded attention.

definition: to give official permission or approval
sentence: The manager authorized the purchase of new equipment.

definition: exercising complete or absolute control; dictatorial
sentence: The autocratic leader made all decisions without consulting.

definition: acting or functioning independently, without control
sentence: The self-driving car operates autonomously.

definition: independence or self-governance
sentence: The region fought for autonomy from central government.

definition: greed for wealth or material gain
sentence: His avarice drove him to prioritize money over relationships.

definition: having an extreme desire for wealth; greedy
sentence: The avaricious businessman would stop at nothing.

definition: to seek revenge or retribution for a wrongdoing
sentence: He vowed to avenge his brother's death by finding justice.

definition: a strong dislike or distaste
sentence: She had an aversion to horror movies.

definition: to prevent or turn away something undesirable
sentence: The quick actions of the lifeguard helped avert drowning.

definition: eager or enthusiastic about something
sentence: He was an avid reader, devouring books of all genres.

definition: to assert or confess openly
sentence: He avowed his love for her in front of everyone.

definition: kind, friendly, and helpful, like an uncle
sentence: The professor had an avuncular approach towards students.

definition: a feeling of reverential respect mixed with fear or wonder
sentence: The majestic mountains filled him with awe.

definition: a self-evident or universally recognized truth
sentence: All humans are mortal is an example of an axiom.

definition: self-evident or unquestionably true by definition
sentence: It is axiomatic that honesty is the foundation of trust.
